    public class GameMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class used to store the map of the game
    Author:
    Jose Freixo and Ruben Torres
    See Also:

        Parameters:

        Representation - Which Char you want to put on given position.

      • validPosition

        public boolean validPosition(int y,
                             int x)
        Checks if a given position on the map is a Wall or a closed door (which means you can't move there)
        Parameters:
        y - coordinate Y of a position of the map
        x - coordinate X of a position of the map
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true if the position is valid, false if otherwise.

      • copyMap

        public char[][] copyMap(char[][] mapa)
        Copy a given char[][] to another in different memory position
        Parameters:
        mapa - map to copy
        Returns:
        char[][] Returns a char[][] that contains the map copied

      • setUnitPosMap

        public void setUnitPosMap(CellPosition position_to_set,
                          CellPosition position_to_erase,
                          char representation)
        Set a char on a given position of the map and erases a char (replaces it with ' ') on a given position
        Parameters:
        position_to_set - position you want to set a char on
        position_to_erase - position you want to erase
        representation - char to set on given position

      • openDoors

        public void openDoors(boolean isKey,
                      CellPosition heroiPos)
        If there's a key and this the hero tries to move against a closed door with it, the function opens that door and all the doors adjacent to it recursively If there's a lever, when the hero pushes it, all of the outer doors open
        Parameters:
        isKey - used to know if the map has a lever or a key
        heroiPos - position of the Hero
